history.content: If you are otherwise going to get a C-, yes do it, it's impossible. With a C you would need flat A's in the other two pre-reqs to declare and with a C+ you need an A and A-. Honestly if you're getting some form of a C and you're really set on doing CS, I would recommend taking the D+. If youre getting some version of B or you're not 110% set on CS I would not retake. There's always minoring, and retaking a class sometimes isn't the best use of your time here at Cal.

I am strongly considering taking a D+ in cs61B so that I can retake it for a higher grade to meet 

the CS GPA cutoff. I was wondering if the retaken class would replace the D+ in my overall GPA

and whether there would be any grad school implications for following this path if I want to pursue

CS further?
history.subject: Grad School Question
